travel.bookDescription: The Alchemist is a novel by Brazilian author Paulo Coelho that was first published in 1988. Originally written in Portuguese, it became a widely translated international bestseller. An allegorical novel, The Alchemist follows a young Andalusian shepherd in his journey to the pyramids of Egypt, after having a recurring dream of finding a treasure there.

The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger, first published in 1951. It is a story about a teenager named Holden Caulfield, who is expelled from his school and goes on a journey of self-discovery in New York City.
Into the Wild is a non-fiction book by Jon Krakauer that was first published in 1996. It tells the story of Christopher McCandless, a young

Wild: From Lost to Found on the Pacific Crest Trail is a memoir by American author Cheryl Strayed, first published in 2012. It tells the story of Strayed's 1,100-mile hike on the Pacific Crest Trail in 1995, following the death of her mother and the dissolution of her marriage.

On the Road is a novel by American writer Jack Kerouac, based on the travels of Kerouac and his friends across the United States. It was first published in 1957 and is considered a defining work of the postwar Beat and Counterculture generations, with its protagonists living life against a backdrop of jazz, poetry, and drug use.

The Sun Also Rises is a novel by American writer Ernest Hemingway that was first published in 1926. It is about a group of American and British expatriates who travel from Paris to the Festival of San Ferm√≠n in Pamplona to watch the running of the bulls and the bullfights.

The Beach is a novel by English author Alex Garland that was first published in 1996. It tells the story of a young backpacker who discovers a hidden beach in Thailand that is untouched by tourism, only to find that paradise comes with its own set of problems.

The Road is a novel by American writer Cormac McCarthy that was first published in 2006. It tells the story of a father and son who journey across a post-apocalyptic landscape in search of safety and a better life.
